item.title: Tom add a quote by Susan Ertz
item.description: "... millions long for immortality who don't know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon." -- Susan Ertz

item.title: Tom add a quote by Ian Dury
item.description: "All I want for my birthday is another birthday." -- Ian Dury

item.title: Tom add a quote by Charles Walter Stansby Williams
item.description: "How can one bargain for anything that is worth while? And what else is worth bargaining for?" -- Charles Walter Stansby Williams

item.title: Tom add a quote by W H Auden
item.description: "Clear, unscalable, ahead Rise the Mountains of Instead, From whose cold, cascading streams None may drink except in dreams." -- W H Auden

item.title: Tom add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "No-one is exempt from speaking nonsense – the only misfortune is to do it solemnly." -- Montaigne

item.title: Tom add a quote by Buckminster Fuller
item.description: "Sometimes I think we're alone. Sometimes I think we're not. In either case, the thought is quite staggering" -- Buckminster Fuller

item.title: Tom add a quote by Patrick O'Brian
item.description: "We understood one another better before ever I opened my mouth" -- Patrick O'Brian

item.title: Tom add a quote by Galileo Galilei
item.description: "I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use." -- Galileo Galilei

item.title: Tom add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Tom add a quote by Jean-Jacques Rousseau
item.description: "The first person who, having enclosed a plot of land, took it into his head to say this is mine and found people simple enough to believe him was the true founder of civil society. What crimes, wars, murders, what miseries and horrors would the human race have been spared, had some one pulled up the stakes or filled in the ditch and cried out to his fellow men: "Do not listen to this imposter. You are lost if you forget that the fruits of the earth belong to all and the earth to no one!" -- Jean-Jacques Rousseau
